title: Broadchurch viewers praise show’s ‘harrowing’ return to former glory for series three
text:
Broadchurch viewers praise show’s ‘harrowing’ return to former glory for series three The last series of ITV's hit crime drama started with a disturbing case and viewers loved it Share Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! The eagerly-anticipated final series of Broadchurch started tonight with a chilling new case for detectives Hardy and Miller to investigate. 
David Tennant and Olivia Coleman returned to our screens for the new series that picks up three years after the end of series two. 
Hardy and Miller began their hunt to find the culprit of a serious sexual assault. 
And viewers were completely gripped from the outset. 
Viewers were thrown straight into the action as farm shop worker Trish Winterman, played by former Coronation Street favourite Julie Hesmondhalgh, was met at the harbour by Miller to reveal details of her horrifying attack. 
It was quickly discovered that Trish’s terrifying ordeal took place at the birthday party of her friend Cath (Sarah Parish), who started to question the involvement of her husband Jim who runs a local garage. 
Trish claimed to have been attacked from behind by a mystery male predator, leaving a long list of suspects for the detectives to interview and eliminate. Broadchurch returns for its final series (Photo: ITV) Viewers praised the harrowing scenes (Photo: Kudos/Imaginary Friends/Sister Pictures/ITV) 
Hardy promised to find the sick attacker, but the toll of another harrowing crime in the close-knit coastal community could prove too much. 
One of the first to be interrogated was be Lenny Henry’s widower Ed, who claimed he’s not a violent man but angrily jumped up from his chair while being questioned by DI Miller and is the manager of the shop where Trish works. 
The action took viewers across stunning landscapes including the familiar site of Dorset’s Jurrasic Coast and a babbling stream by an extravagant stately home. Trish is the victim of sexual assault (Photo: ITV) 
Other new cast members include Georgina Campbell as an opinionated and ambitious young detective and funnyman Charlie Higson in an unfamiliar dramatic role as Trish’s estranged husband Ian, who recently left her for another woman. 
Reverend Paul Coates (Arthur Darvill) is back to provide more support alongside Danny Latimer’s grieving mother Beth (Jodie Whittaker), who saw Joe Miller acquitted of her son's murder in series two. 
*Broadchurch continues on ITV next Monday at 9pm. Like us on Facebook
